edu.uci.ics.crawler4j.crawler

Class CrawlController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uci.ics.crawler4j.crawler.Configurable
      • edu.uci.ics.crawler4j.crawler.CrawlController

  • public class CrawlController
extends Configurable
    The controller that manages a crawling session. This class creates the crawler threads and monitors their progress.

    • Method Detail

      • addSeed

        public void addSeed(java.lang.String pageUrl)
        Adds a new seed URL. A seed URL is a URL that is fetched by the crawler to extract new URLs in it and follow them for crawling.
        Parameters:
        pageUrl - the URL of the seed

      • addSeed

        public void addSeed(java.lang.String pageUrl,
                    int docId)
        Adds a new seed URL. A seed URL is a URL that is fetched by the crawler to extract new URLs in it and follow them for crawling. You can also specify a specific document id to be assigned to this seed URL. This document id needs to be unique. Also, note that if you add three seeds with document ids 1,2, and 7. Then the next URL that is found during the crawl will get a doc id of 8. Also you need to ensure to add seeds in increasing order of document ids. Specifying doc ids is mainly useful when you have had a previous crawl and have stored the results and want to start a new crawl with seeds which get the same document ids as the previous crawl.
        Parameters:
        pageUrl - the URL of the seed
        docId - the document id that you want to be assigned to this seed URL.

      • addSeenUrl

        public void addSeenUrl(java.lang.String url,
                       int docId)
        This function can called to assign a specific document id to a url. This feature is useful when you have had a previous crawl and have stored the Urls and their associated document ids and want to have a new crawl which is aware of the previously seen Urls and won't re-crawl them. Note that if you add three seen Urls with document ids 1,2, and 7. Then the next URL that is found during the crawl will get a doc id of 8. Also you need to ensure to add seen Urls in increasing order of document ids.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the page
        docId - the document id that you want to be assigned to this URL.

      • getCrawlersLocalData

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getCrawlersLocalData()
        Once the crawling session finishes the controller collects the local data of the crawler threads and stores them in a List. This function returns the reference to this list.
        Returns:
        List of Objects which are your local data

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Set the current crawling session set to 'shutdown'. Crawler threads monitor the shutdown flag and when it is set to true, they will no longer process new pages.

      • start

        public <T extends WebCrawler> void start(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                         int numberOfCrawlers)
        Start the crawling session and wait for it to finish. This method utilizes default crawler factory that creates new crawler using Java reflection
        Type Parameters:
        T - Your class extending WebCrawler
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class that implements the logic for crawler threads
        numberOfCrawlers - the number of concurrent threads that will be contributing in this crawling session.

      • start

        public <T extends WebCrawler> void start(CrawlController.WebCrawlerFactory<T> crawlerFactory,
                                         int numberOfCrawlers)
        Start the crawling session and wait for it to finish.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Your class extending WebCrawler
        Parameters:
        crawlerFactory - factory to create crawlers on demand for each thread
        numberOfCrawlers - the number of concurrent threads that will be contributing in this crawling session.
